file_content.text: Want to hear something hilarious? I'm almost homesick for Korriban.
The heat does not trouble me, but keep cool on this world, little Sith.
Looks like the Imps did a number on this place. Come on--let's get done before your skin starts peeling.
People look nervous with all the Imperials here. That's not a good sign. Maybe we should keep a low profile.
So this is where the scum of the galaxy congregate. Not sure I see the appeal.
I have an excellent sabacc face. That was a joke. I hate sabacc.
Sleazy little cantina. If I had to live on a planet like this, I'd be drinking here, too.
I've never been so happy to wander into a scuzzy dive. Anything is better than that heat.
What do you say we buy a droid to clean up the ship?
More worthless junk.
What do you figure? Scrap, or is there something decent around here?
Think someone brought that giant chunk of junk, or the whole market sprung up around a crashed ship?
This reminds me of a cave I found on Corrida. Almost died there. Great, now I'm having flashbacks.
All the power has passed from this place.
The Sand People are freaks, but I kind of like them. Mean, nasty, tribal... little taste of home.
Well, somebody's living out here. Maybe we should just leave them be, it's not like people are very friendly around here.
Did I ever tell you I have a fear of dying in the belly of a beast?
These monsters are nothing but dumb prey.
Yeah... wait a minute. Let's just take this in for a second.
Wow, that's gorgeous. Who'd have thought a hole in the ground could be so... majestic?
Nice to be out of the sun. But wait for my eyes to adjust, will ya?
If they had this technology on Korriban, perhaps it wouldn't have taken so long to awaken me. Perhaps I wouldn't be your slave.
Little piece of Dromund Kaas, smack in the middle of the desert. Just in case you get homesick.
Quite a setup the Imperial Reclamation Service has got out here. I wonder what they're hoping to dig up.
This is either a mirage or a trap set by a nasty underwater monster. Or both.
Water in the desert. A strange sight.
Mark it on the map. Next time the speeders break down, we're walking back here.
Oh! Water! Can we take a break? Please?
As if endless sand wasn't bad enough--here's sand with teeth!
The planet's grinning maw. I wonder how long you'd fall until I could no longer hear your screams.
That's a real sarlacc. They say those things take forever to eat you--you can live in its stomach while it scars you up. Kind of poetic.
Ack! What is that! It's like a big... mouth, maybe? I can't even tell. Let's give it a wide... let's just stay away from it.
If we don't get out of the sun soon, I'm gonna turn purple.
We could destroy this place and no one would notice.
Mess up badly enough, bet your bosses would assign you right here. Wonder what these guys did.
That shade looks so good right now. What kind of sadist puts a planet next to two suns?
I've seen Czerka's work on other worlds. Never pleasant.
What delicious new horrors are they digging up here?
I don't want to sound like a wuss, but we really don't have to go down here.
Ever considered that Czerka abandoned this place for a reason? Maybe we shouldn't be poking around.
Jawa market = selling controlled droids? // T7 = uncomfortable!
Somebody needs to tell the Jawas that tooling around in a giant vehicle doesn't help them look any bigger. Still, it's a nice ride.
Jawas know desert, repairs, gossip. Good to listen.
These little fellas must be professional junk dealers. Considering the size of that crawler, business must be good.
Pretty impressive for such little guys. I wonder how they keep that old thing running.
Gamorrean life-forms detected // Hostiles moving to intercept
Typical Czerka mentality. Pull out on a day's notice and leave a nice big base for the bad guys to move into.
To whatever world they come, Czerka leave mark.
This is a nice little underground hideout Czerka left behind. We should keep it for ourselves.
No telling how long ago Czerka dug this place out. Could be anything in there.
Dreviad Outpost = safe from Sand People attacks
I'll never understand Tatooine settlers. "We live in a giant wasteland. Let's build everything really far apart!"
Hmm. Hot sun, beasts to fight... could stay?
I'm all for wide-open spaces, but why would anybody want to live out in the middle of a desert? A man's gotta have some shade.
Why would anyone live in a place like this? It's a wasteland.
Multiple Geonosian life-forms detected // Location = must be main base
Geonosians are dug in deep here. Gonna be messy rooting them out.
Soft, Herald. Eyes on us.
If these bug-fellas from Geonosis weren't making trouble for everyone, I'd say let them have Tatooine. I mean, seriously.
Looks like the Geonosians' HQ. They must have a huge operation out here.
T7 external temperature dropping = good for servomotors
Whoever built this must hate sunlight. Then again, it is Tatooine....
Is home of soft things.
Check out the size of this place. These farmers live better than they let on.
Not the coziest house I've been in, but it beats standing out in the sun.
T7 = relieved to be inside // Tatooine sand = hard on circuits
Have to hand it to the SIS. Nobody does "nondescript" quite like them.
Is too small here.
Somehow, I expected a bit more from a spy's house.
So the SIS is taking an interest in this dustball, too? What are the odds.
Twin Suns gang = running illegal dig site // Jedi + T7 = put them out of business!
I'm sure whatever's happening here is perfectly legal. Let's ask to see their permits.
What is to mine on Tatooine?
Quite an operation these Twin Suns got going. Better than that scum deserves.
I didn't think there was anything worth mining here anymore....
Remains of krayt dragon = extremely large // T7 = relieved creature deactivated
Ah, Tatooine. You never run out of ways to let me know I should be dead.
Elder krayt dragon. Noble predator, devours all lesser things. Has earned its sleep.
Know what these bones tell me? If you stay here long enough, Tatooine will kill you.
Whoa. That must be a krayt dragon--or what's left of one, at least.
Jedi + T7 = stop for a rest? // Camp = appears safe
I don't know why more people don't live here. Once you get past the endless wastes and blistering heat--oh, and things trying to kill you--it's really nice.
See tracks? Has been many Sand People here.
This place gets hit by Sand People all the time. These locals are blasted stubborn to stay and fight it out.
These people must be insane to live out here. They're nothing but easy targets.
T7 = detecting unusual energy readings + unknown organics
Dear Czerka, please stop discovering horrible ancient things. Love, Kira.
Czerka places. Always secrets hidden.
Seems like every Czerka place we visit has a creep factor of ten. Must be in their corporate philosophy.
Czerka was definitely up to a lot more than just mining out here.
Briefing: Records indicate Tatooine's average daily temperature is well above tolerable organic levels. My sympathies, master.
Insight: At least now we know where to find the local undesirables.
Judgment: Buying droid parts here would be like acquiring replacement organs from a butcher.
Presentation: This appears to be a place of spiritual significance to the organic natives... pathetic savages.
Rumination: One must admire Tatooine's wildlife. These creatures are master liquidators.
Analysis: It appears your fellow Imperials got homesick, master. This architecture is quite homey.
Advice: You may wish to stop and splash a bit of water on yourself, master. You're looking a little peaked.
Dismissal: The mighty Sarlacc... possibly the least-efficient predator in galactic history.
Hypothesis: I may require replacement photoreceptors after we leave this world. These ambient light levels are harsh indeed.
Contemplation: What is it about organics and their need to dig holes in sand?
Announcement: These Jawas are droid scavengers, master. I will refrain from deleting them unless you say otherwise. Please... say otherwise?
Estimation: Scanners indicate multiple troublemakers infesting this facility. There will be many deletions. Hooray!
Observation: This planet's inhabitants appear to require inordinate amounts of personal space.
Revelation: Geonosians are especially satisfying to delete, master. Their carapaces make the most interesting sound when broken.
Analysis: So this is how the natives spend their credits. Not exactly Nar Shaddaa, is it?
Assessment: Apparently the Republic SIS works under severe budgetary restraints.
Encouragement: These troublemakers appear to enjoy digging holes in the sand--let's bury them in one.
Contemplation: Krayt dragon bones, master--another reminder that no organic lives forever. Droids, however....
Judgment: These natives take stubbornness to unusual extremes. Perhaps the heat has broken them.
Alert: I am receiving highly unusual and erratic sensor data. Weapons armed.
